intro: Phanera gracillima, commonly known as the slender phanera, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a climbing vine that belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features small, heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of pale yellow flowers. Its botanical characteristics include a fibrous root system and hairy stems. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in warm climates.
